Description: Handle and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery type A cup; interior glazed black; exterior: handle glazed save internal side; between handle roots, black-figure decoration consisting of tripod (part of legs missing; added red on bowl).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd joins Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA215.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 128, pl. XXXIX, no. 357.6)
CVA Boston II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum USA, Fasc. 19, Museum of Fine Arts, Boston (p.47, pl. 109, no. 19)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 234, no. 198)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1433) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4783 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
